block.p: An article yesterday about a decline in AIDS deaths gave inconsistent figures in some editions for the percentage decline in deaths nationally for the first six months of 1996. The figure for the decline stated by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta was 13 percent, but the agency provided a rounded estimate of the numbers of deaths, which worked out to a decline of 12 percent. The exact numbers are not yet available.
